title: 114_hr3765
content: The "ADA Education and Reform Act of 2015" aims to promote access to public accommodations for persons with disabilities through education and training programs. The Act also addresses unfair and deceptive practices related to ADA compliance demand letters. It is illegal to send a demand letter alleging ADA violations without specifying the details of the denial of access to a public accommodation. Violators will be fined under title 18, United States Code. Paragraph (1) of section 308(a) of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to provide remedies and procedures for discrimination based on disability, without requiring futile gestures from individuals with disabilities. A civil action for failure to remove architectural barriers in existing public accommodations requires a specific written notice to the owner or operator. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to provide remedies and procedures for discrimination based on disability. A civil action for failure to remove architectural barriers in existing public accommodations requires a specific written notice to the owner or operator within a certain timeframe. SEC. 5. The Judicial Conference of the United States will develop a model program for mediation in ADA actions related to architectural barriers. The program aims to resolve claims efficiently without costly litigation, including a stay of discovery during mediation. The Federal Judicial Center may provide a public comment period on the proposal. The model program will expedite the determination of relevant facts and steps to resolve access issues before litigation. The Act and its amendments will take effect 30 days after enactment.
